Did you know that Firelands has an issue on the ballot?

The Firelands Board of Education voted unanimously to place a 5.98 mil, 10-year substitute levy that does not increase taxes on the November ballot. This issue consolidates and replaces two existing emergency levies that expire in 2021 into one substitute levy that will not increase taxes. A substitute levy allows Firelands School to combine existing levies, generate additional revenue from new homes that are built, and keep your taxes the same.

For additional information please visit our webpage at: https://www.firelandsschools.org/SubstituteLevy2020.aspx

Luke Dempsey is in the Senior Spotlight!

During high school, his accomplishments included marching and concert bands, cross country, track and field, wrestling, JSA, and FFA. Outside of high school, Luke has been active in Boy Scouts, where he served as the youth leader on a high adventure hiking trip on the Appalachian Trail in Maine, and is weeks away from earning his Eagle rank. His years in the FFA Wildlife and Forestry programs, combined with his experiences in Boy Scouts, have led him to his future plans to become a wildlife resource officer.

Luke’s favorite high school memories include spending time with friends in both band and cross country.

Luke will attend Hocking College where he will major in Wildlife Management.

He is the son of Mike and Teresa Dempsey.

Our Firelands Community has started a movement to "Adopt a Senior"!

Parents/Guardians simply post a picture and short bio about their senior and any person willing to 'adopt' the senior comments under the post. Once the senior is spoken for the parent/guardian edits the post and writes 'adopted' on the first line. The private Facebook page, Firelands Class of 2020 Adopt a Senior, shares additional information.

To date, over 40 seniors have shared information and almost all have been adopted! The group is encouraging all senior families to participate.

Once you adopt the senior you support the senior with small gifts, words of encouragement and fun surprises. The items that you provide are up to your discretion.

Please request access to the Firelands Class of 2020 Adopt a Senior page if you are interested in this supportive project.

Ohio Launches Toll-Free ‘COVID Careline’ to Provide Emotional Support for Ohioans: 1-800-720-9616

The Ohio Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services (OhioMHAS) today joined with Governor Mike DeWine and RecoveryOhio to launch a new, toll-free Careline to provide emotional support for Ohioans who are experiencing stress, anxiety, fear, sadness and loneliness amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Ohioans may call 1-800-720-9616 to connect with trained counselors for 24/7 support. The Careline is staffed by credentialed counselors who have been trained to provide FREE, confidential support for a wide range of needs, including mental health concerns, substance use, problem gambling, and more.

Individuals experiencing an acute crisis can still reach out to the Ohio Crisis Text Line (keyword 4HOPE to 741 741) or the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline (1-800-273-8255). Find more information, and sample social media posts, at http://mha.ohio.gov/careline.
